Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2014 06:23PM Nikkito wrote: Hi mjm1, Hope that you've had a good day. I'm so thankful to "not" have a longer wait. Can't imagine. That certainly played a big part in my transferring hospitals. Nervous about tomorrow. But I'm trying to give it up to the universe so to speak.  I'm glad to hear that your mum is doing well with her treatments and is managing the SE's. I wish you many years to come with her by your side! I'm sure she appreciates your love and support greatly.Happy to hear that your lumps turned out to be b9 as well! Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2014 06:34PM Nikkito wrote: Hi ladies, thanks very much for your responses. I will be so happy to get the biopsy done and behind me as you all know the waiting is difficult *sigh*, but I appreciate you all waiting with me. I got the call from the hospital yesterday, the booking lady said she was booking me in as soon as she could, next Wednesday. I didn't register it at the time, but she said it's because "we only do one of these per day". After I got off the phone I thought how odd, it's a cancer centre how do they only do one biopsy per day. Hopefully it's not a lobotomy they've booked me in for lol. Sorry a bit of dark humor!.Then had the thought, do they mean an excisional biopsy. But think they would have told me if that were the case. My understanding is it's a core biopsy. She suggested I have them contact me with cancellations. I tried calling today but just got voicemail, so I  will try again tomorrow. Holeinone, thankfully my experiences with the onc and radiologist/techs and other staff have been quite positive so far. Nope never got a birad score, not sure if they have the same here (canada) on my original u/s just gave all the descriptive stuff and their recommendations. I haven't gotten the results yet from my u/s and mammo from the bc done on Saturday. I was supposed to meet with the onc this Tuesday, but cancelled and rescheduled so that I could go in to see her after all of the results including the biopsy had come in. And you're right one step at a time in terms of what to worry myself with. Do you mind my asking how they recognized and discovered your lobular cancer? Hope your week is good! Thanks for that reminder infobabe! I will be sure to ask for copies of the pathology reports as well as the u/s and mammo reports.  Thanks mjm1 for all of this info, I think I need to write out a list of questions to ask the doctor. Including getting more info on the different types of lumps. That's amazing that they removed those masses without there being a noticeable difference for you! Hope your mum is having a good week. Goodnight all. x
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2014 04:30PM Nikkito wrote: mjm1, Thank you for sharing and for your support. I can appreciate how difficult it must have been for both you and your mother to hear that news. I'm sorry, cancer really sucks, I've been through it with a few close family members and now I'm here. How is your mum doing now? I do feel very fortunate to have access to a good hospital. We're human and as such experience complex and varied emotions when faced with something like this. I've kept telling myself like you've said, if I have to do this I will get through it. I think I'll be much better when I have all the information. It was a beautiful spring day, had a nice walk down at the water with my son. Thanks again and hope you have a good evening.
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2014 04:09PM Nikkito wrote: Thanks Ddkath & NSwrites Just been feeling a little worn out and down. Had my u/s at the hospital yesterday. So I have a lot of cysts, but there is the one that they are concerned about that I'll be having the biopsy on this week. Solid, 3.3 cm. Apparently there are calcifications as well. So the radiologist did the scan and then had the doctor come in and do it. From there I went to have a topographic mammogram, they took a bunch of pics of that one mass. So I'm just waiting to hear tomorrow when my appointment will be to have the biopsy. They couldn't do it yesterday because that department isn't open on the weekend. Good news was that my lymph looked ok on this scan.  Ddkath hope you are making out ok this weekend - know that you had a lot to get done, thinking of you. NSwrites, I'm sorry that you are going through this experience. I would trust your feelings and ask for further clarification on what the radiologist felt he was seeing and a biopsy. When do you get the report of that?. I haven't read all of your posts so forgive me, do you have a doctor that you trust?Can you be referred to a breast centre? I also know how difficult it is when you have young children and also have this to deal with. Hugs to you both
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2014 07:20PM Nikkito wrote: So I have one fully solid mass which is the one being biopsied, but then I have a number of cysts some of which are "complicated". So here's my question should I be worrying at all about these other complex cysts?? My hope of course is that this mass that I will be having the biopsy on will turn out to be a fibroadenoma. Now because I have this mass and other cysts I will be monitored by the BC - In future how will I know what to be concerned about and what not to? A number of these lumps are palpable, how will I know when there is a real difference in current lumps or new lumps? Lumps lumps and more lumps. Frustrating! Even when doing an u/s it gets very confusing which lump is which! And at what size should I consider having them removed? (Lump being biopsied is 3.3 cm) The thing is I have small breasts and if they were to start removing these I wouldn't have much left!. This has been quite stressful and I imagine it will continue to be somewhat stressful knowing that I have a lot going on in there. The main thing of course is that I just want to ensure that none of these have cancer. Just wondering if anyone could offer input, as how to best deal with very lumpy small breasts? Thanks for reading!

Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Nikkito wrote: Hi there, so that last few weeks of waiting have been rather hellish. I have my first appointment with an oncologist on Tuesday. I never expected to be dealing with this at this point in my life. I'm mid thirties with a nine year old son. Three weeks ago I went for a physical, expecting the usual, that all would be fine and I would go on my merry way until next year. Well my doctor felt a few lumps in my breast and ordered an ultrasound. I still thought no big deal, cysts. Well the ultrasound results came back and showed complex cysts but also two abnormal lesions and an abnormal lymph node in my right axilla (that was the real kicker). Anyhow I was going to get a biopsy and more testing at one hospital, but then decided to switch to a hospital that specializes in cancer. So I've been waiting for them to do the consult this week and waiting to hear when my appointment  would be for biopsy. So I got the call that they did the consult and decided to have me see one of the onc's. I think I have managed this all fairly well, but inside I'm rather terrified. I have felt alone and anxious and overwhelmed. My house is a disaster. I'm afraid of what I'm going to face this week. I'm worried about my son. I'm going to a place that is totally unfamiliar to me, with people that are also unfamiliar. It's the unknown. It's that this all feels so out of my control. It's that if I hear the words this week, you have cancer, I feel as though I'm going to fall to pieces.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2014 04:09PM Nikkito wrote: TB90, congrats on finishing your treatment And glad to hear that your feeling good! It's hopeful to hear and remembering, as you've said that there is another side and even if I have to travel this path, that I can get there too. So thank you for taking the time to share, it' appreciated. Holeinone, thank you. Yes you are absolutely right in how overwhelming it all is, when you say you felt as though your legs weren't working, I get it. Are you doing radiation? Great mantra btw. Jeslyn, I so appreciate you taking the time to sign up and respond. First I'm sorry that you have to deal with all of this, especially while being a mom to your children and going about life. But I smiled while reading because I can feel your strength and gutspa and love for your kids! I appreciate your humour too. If you don't mind my asking, in your case why did they choose chemo first and then surgery?  Campkid195, absolutely. I just read your other post and I can appreciate the fear of finding these lumps. One step at a time and deep breaths. First step is seeing your doctor and then having and ultrasound. Don't be nervous in telling your doctor, she'll want to know so that it can get checked. Hopefully she can get you an ultrasound quickly to cut down on the wait and worry for you. I believe that they will be doing the biopsy on Tuesday, fortunately they have rapid diagnostics there, so I should be able to get the results pretty quickly. My initial impression was that I would be going to the clinic having an exam done by the np and then I would have the biopsy/ and any other tests and then I would have an appointment a day or two after to get my results from the doctor. Now this has changed a bit to seeing the onc first and then going from there. So the waiting is just nerve wracking. In reality it's only a few more days, but it feels as though it's stretching on forever. I'm trying to keep calm, especially for my sons sake but my emotions are so fluid and fluctuating. I am very thankful for this site because it has given me information and all of you ladies have been wonderful and supportive. This was actually my first experience of posting in a forum. I struggle sometimes with sharing and asking for help, but it truly does help.This has shown me in a very powerful way the ways in which I've sometimes neglected to take of myself. An ultrasound was ordered last year for the same breast and I didn't go. I just kept putting it off, until I felt that I had put it off beyond being able to go in for it. I guess I've carried a few misconceptions, you practically need a magnify glass to find my boobs(not really but they're not gonna knock you over or anything lol) so that was the first, that if I had larger breasts then it would be more of a concern. Anyway throughout the year it kept nagging me that I hadn't gone and then came this years physical and here we are. The hospital that I'm going to is one of the best and I'm thankful. Just scared. There have even been moments where I feel a sort of primal scream rising.  But hearing from you is helping me keep it together.And my heart really goes out for all that you've each individually dealt with but along this road and with that a "Wow"these women are incredibly strong! Thank you
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2014 11:27AM Nikkito wrote: Hi Ddkath and mjm1  I met with the oncologist and she was great. I was hoping they would get everything done in one visit, but as it is I have to go back Saturday for another scan and then they will biopsy what they need to then. It appears that I have a heck of a lot going on in there, but I'm still hanging on to hope! She found two more spots that they hadn't found or noted on the original report! : /  really looking forward to getting Saturday done, I hate the waiting part. I've been having a hard time sleeping and last night I had a nightmare, you know the kind where you wake up and your still kind of "in" it, of course it was about this.  Ddkath I just read your other post. I'm sorry to hear about the nodes and that they have to go back in, certainly not the news you wanted I know. I understand your fear regarding chemo. But as you've said you'll fight the good fight. Try to think of it as a small part of the whole...to beating it and getting it gone! mjm1, how's your mum doing( and how are you?)is she having treatment this week? Hope you ladies are having a good day. Let us know how you're making out.
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2014 07:09PM Nikkito wrote: Thanks so much for your support ladies, means a lot! Hope everyone had a good day. Pretty busy day for me which was kind of good because it kept me somewhat distracted. One more day to go until Saturday!  Reading of your experiences reminds me that I will be fine.There is a store close to where we live that is popular for making these t-shirts etc with the Phrase "keep calm and carry on" and the flip side phrase "now panic and freak out" perhaps One day I could wear one and the next the other!, or maybe it's more like one hour I can wear one and then the next the other lol. It's a bit nuts for anyone Dx to have to make the decision within (often a few days)whether to remove their whole breast or a portion! But that is indeed what happens.You are then in a position where you have to make huge decisions that have a big impact on your life(and the lives of those around you) and it is astounding how many women find themselves in that place and remarkalbly put one foot in front of the other, keep going and kick c's but!!!  mjm1, I'm glad to hear that your mum and you are well. I think walking is a great thing, a little exercise and fresh air is always good. Now that spring is about, flowers will start to bloom, sun is shining, birds are busy.Please tell your mum thank you and let her know that she will be in my thoughts and that I send my love back. I hope she is feeling even better today! StayingFocus, Thank you. As you've said, the one thing we can be certain of in life...is the uncertainty! Beautiful to read through your story and learn that you are NED. That's wonderful! Holeinone- yep, one more day. Looking forward to having the wait behind me. Hate not knowing what to expect. I think they wanted her to examine me, and they are repeating the scan because the original wasn't done with them and I guess because they have the expertise in bc, they prefer their own people. That's great news that your rads are finished!. But I can appreciate that it's a whole new transition now, the emotional healing takes time. But you've come a long way! The survivor classes sound like a good way to begin.  RaeBae, how are you feeling since your surgery? (Hope all is well for you) Glad that you also found this community. I would have to agree that it is a wonderful place and I am sure that you will get much support here! Mazie73, congrats on finishing chemo! I really like that a lot: "I can't go on. I'll go on" that captures the entirety of it doesn't it? Thanks for the link too! I came across her blog a few days ago. I think she actually lives quite close to where I do. And I really appreciate being able to read others experiences, it helps. I hope that as each day passes that you only feel stronger! Ddkath, going to hop on over and respond on your thread ; ) I appreciate your continued support through the wait! Hugs and a good night to all of you.
Posts.Title: Where I'm at...just needing a little support Nikkito Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2014 07:43PM Nikkito wrote: Hi Dd, sorry for the delay in my reply, my son has been sick with the flu for the last couple of days.My biopsy went well and you were right, I was fine. It was very simple and straightforward and not nearly as bad as imagined! After the freezing I really didn't feel anything.A little bit of discomfort the day of after freezing, but now it's fine. I go in for my results on Tuesday. And then into my GP for other results on Wednesday. I'm happy to hear that they are now confident that they've gotten it all for you, that's good news! And I'm sure it's a relief to have that part behind you. I understand your fears around chemo...but you will definitely get through it! And be an even stronger cookie!!! From what I've read about others chemo experiences the worst part seems to be the anticipation of "the unknown" of how you will respond. After the first treatment or two you'll have a fairly good idea of how you are going to feel and respond and hopefully it will go smoothly. Thanks for your support and hope your weekend is good.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2014 02:23PM Nikkito wrote: Hello ladies, Thank you, reading your messages are really helping me to cope with the feelings as well as feeling that I am armed with a little more knowledge! ; ) Charger70: Congrats on finishing your active treatments! And a hug to you. I can imagine that being one of the hardest things if you are used to being a fairly active person, suddenly you just can't keep the same pace. Your body tells you And it's not really optional. And yes the waiting... For appointments, treatments etc. I'm glad to hear that you are assigned a " Nurse Navigator" there seems to be so much information that you are suddenly inundated with and I can imagine when I am in the thick of the emotions that it could be hard for me to keep track of it all! Forgive my ignorance, but what's chording? Thanks so much for sharing... Momto3boysaz: I'm glad to hear your surgery went well!...and that you are on to the road of recovery from that. Do you know yet when you are starting radiation? It sounds like you've had a great deal of strength in a short period of time and also like you have a great attitude, that it's a bump in the road that you will move beyond and then get back to your "boring life" as you've said. : )  Ddkath70: I'm glad to hear that you've been able to get an appointment set for next week. Good for you for taking the bull by the horns! I'm sorry that you are still waiting....but I think you said they told you latest Monday right, so by then you should have much more information I hope. *hugs*  In my head I'm having a bit of a hard time not beating myself up a little, I feel stupid and foolish for not having followed through with the ultrasound last year and for having not mentioning things to my doctor that I probably should have. All of a sudden it's like this neon spotlight has been turned on my body and I aware in a way that I have never been before. " Just venting some feelings" It's quite possible that this is totally different and unrelated to any of this stuff going on, but has anyone here ever had lower rib tenderness??. This is something that I've had for a while now. I don't know if what the radiologist may have seen with my abdominal ultrasound could account for this? I guess I'll know know more Tuesday.

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2014 12:58PM Nikkito wrote: Hello to everyone here,  I'm glad to have come across this forum. Thanks to all of you who have shared your experiences! I'm thirty four and during my physical last year (and I think the year before that :( ) my doctor ordered an ultrasound because she felt some lumpiness in one breast in particular. I just immediately thought it's a cyst and put off getting the ultrasound. My breasts are small but dense.So a few days ago I went for my physical again and again she said she had some concern about my right breast. She also ordered an ultrasound on my abdomen and found a small lump on my cervix. So yesterday I went for my ultrasounds and wasn't expecting anything out of the ordinary. But it became clear that there were some issues. One 2cm spot was found and one 3cm spot. There also seemed to be an issue with my abdominal ultrasound, though I don't know yet what that is. I think what scared me in particular was that when she was doing the measurements and looking at one of the spots, I looked and saw the colour doppler light up most of it, which concerned me.At this point I am waiting. The technician also made some comments that concerned me. The waiting is hard! ahhhh. I am fine and then I'll have a moment where my anxiety peaks and of course the question "What if" ? And it's scary.... So that's where I'm at... Thank you for reading and I wish you all a good day!
Posts.Title: Freaked out and have no idea where to start Ddkath70 Holeinone

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2014 03:48PM Nikkito wrote: Ddkath70- Great news! I'm happy to hear this. Count me in your pocket this Wednesday(I'm small so I shouldn't take up too much room! lol) ; ) I'm glad you now have a plan and that you are feeling positive about it. I'm sure all will go well on Wednesday. I decided to make the switch to princess margaret, which felt like the right choice for me. My CD and report went over on Friday and now I'm just waiting to hear from them. When I talked to them last week the lady was wonderful and assured me that she would have me in soon. They have a rapid diagnostic centre which means that everything happens much faster, instead of waiting for a longer period for a full diagnosis/plan. Also relieved to know that they can biopsy the lymph in the same way they do breast. momto3boysaz: I'm glad to hear all is going well since your surgery. Good news that all came out well after one surgery. It does appear to make such a difference to have a "team" approach and everything needed in one place. Can't imagine what it would be like otherwise! Good luck for your appointment Monday. Hope everyone is having a nice weekend
